Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: பேதைப் படுக்கும் இழவூழ் அறிவகற்றும் ஆகலூழ் உற்றக் கடை.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The fate that loss ordains makes wise men's wisdom foolishness; The fate that gain bestows with ampler powers will wisdom bless.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: Again a split composition. On the left, a wise scholar is surrounded by books, but a dark, shadowy hand representing Adverse Fate ('இழவூழ்') covers their eyes, making them appear confused and foolish ('பேதை').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, a simple person is touched by a ray of golden light from a celestial source representing Prosperous Fate ('ஆகலூழ்'). Their mind visibly expands, represented by glowing geometric patterns of wisdom ('அறிவு') forming around their head.
Layered_Composition.Background: A vast, cosmic backdrop suggesting that these forces of fate are universal and beyond human control.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The dual power of Fate: how adverse fate can cloud the mind of the wise, while prosperous fate can grant clarity and expand the knowledge of the simple.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The shadowy hand blinding the scholar represents fate-induced folly. The ray of light and geometric patterns symbolize fate-bestowed wisdom.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The left side is dark and shadowed, with cool tones. The right side is illuminated by a brilliant, warm golden light, with vibrant colors in the wisdom patterns.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Symmetrical wide shot, creating a powerful visual parallel.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic figures with abstract, glowing effects for the mental states.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: High contrast, with a single shadow source on the left and a single light source on the right.

Negative_Prompt: happy scholar on the left, confused person on the right, text on books, blurry, modern clothing.
